segment.name: dataElementErrorIndication
segment.desc: To identify an erroneous stand-alone, composite or component data element, and to identify the nature of the error.

data_element.name: syntaxErrorCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating the error detected.

composite_data_element.name: dataElementIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the position for an erroneous data element. This can be the position of a stand-alone or composite data element in the definition of a segment or a component data element in the definition of a composite data element.

data_element.name: erroneousDataElementPositionInSegment
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the stand-alone or composite data element in error. The segment code and each following stand-alone or composite data element defined in the segment description shall cause the count to be incremented. The segment tag has position number 1.

data_element.name: erroneousComponentDataElementPosition
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the component data element in error. Each component data element position defined in the composite data element description shall cause the count to be incremented. The count starts at 1.

data_element.name: erroneousDataElementOccurrence
data_element.desc: The numerical occurrence of the repeating stand-alone or composite data element in error. Each occurrence (as indicated by the repetition separator) shall cause the count to be incremented. The count starts at 1.

segment.name: groupResponse
segment.desc: To identify a group in the subject interchange and to indicate acknowledgement or rejection (action taken) of the UNG and UNE segments, and to identify any error related to these segments. It can also identify errors related to the USA, USC, USD, USH, USR, UST, or USU security segments when they appear at the group level. Depending on the action code, it may also indicate the action taken on the messages and packages within that group.

data_element.name: groupReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique reference number for the group within an interchange.

composite_data_element.name: applicationSenderIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Sender identification of for example a division, branch or application computer system/process.

data_element.name: applicationSenderIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded identification of the application sender (for example, a division, branch or computer system/process).

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the identification code.

composite_data_element.name: applicationRecipientIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Recipient identification of for example a division, branch or application computer system/process.

data_element.name: applicationRecipientIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded identification of the application recipient (for example, a division, branch or computer system/process).

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the identification code.

data_element.name: actionCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating acknowledgement, or rejection (the action taken) of a subject interchange, or part of the subject interchange, or indication of interchange receipt.

data_element.name: syntaxErrorCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating the error detected.

data_element.name: serviceSegmentTagCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a service segment.

composite_data_element.name: dataElementIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the position for an erroneous data element. This can be the position of a stand-alone or composite data element in the definition of a segment or a component data element in the definition of a composite data element.

data_element.name: erroneousDataElementPositionInSegment
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the stand-alone or composite data element in error. The segment code and each following stand-alone or composite data element defined in the segment description shall cause the count to be incremented. The segment tag has position number 1.

data_element.name: erroneousComponentDataElementPosition
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the component data element in error. Each component data element position defined in the composite data element description shall cause the count to be incremented. The count starts at 1.

data_element.name: erroneousDataElementOccurrence
data_element.desc: The numerical occurrence of the repeating stand-alone or composite data element in error. Each occurrence (as indicated by the repetition separator) shall cause the count to be incremented. The count starts at 1.

data_element.name: securityReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique reference number assigned by the security originator to a pair of security header and security trailer groups.

data_element.name: securitySegmentPosition
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of a specific security segment that is within the actual received security header/trailer segment group pair, identified by its security reference number. The numbering starts with, and includes, the USH segment as segment number 1. To identify a security segment that contains an error, this is the numerical count position of that security segment. To report that a security segment is missing, this is the numerical count position of the last security segment that was processed before the position where the missing security segment was expected to be. A missing security segment group is denoted by identifying the first segment in the security segment group as missing.

segment.name: interchangeResponse
segment.desc: To identify the subject interchange, to indicate interchange receipt, to indicate acknowledgement or rejection (action taken) of the UNA, UNB and UNZ segments, and to identify any error related to these segments. It can also identify errors related to the USA, USC, USD, USH, USR, UST, or USU security segments when they appear at the interchange level. Depending on the action code, it may also indicate the action taken on the groups, messages, and packages within that interchange.

data_element.name: interchangeControlReference
data_element.desc: Unique reference assigned by the sender to an interchange.

composite_data_element.name: interchangeSender
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the sender of the interchange.

data_element.name: interchangeSenderIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded identification of the sender of the interchange.

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the identification code.

data_element.name: interchangeSenderInternalIdentification
data_element.desc: Identification (for example, a division, branch or computer system/process) specified by the sender of interchange, to be included if agreed, by the recipient in response interchanges, to facilitate internal routing.

data_element.name: interchangeSenderInternalSubidentification
data_element.desc: Sub-level of sender internal identification, when further sub-level identification is required.

composite_data_element.name: interchangeRecipient
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the recipient of the interchange.

data_element.name: interchangeRecipientIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded identification of the recipient of the interchange.

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the identification code.

data_element.name: interchangeRecipientInternalIdentification
data_element.desc: Identification (for example, a division, branch or computer system/process) specified by the recipient of interchange, to be included if agreed, by the sender in response interchanges, to facilitate internal routing.

data_element.name: interchangeRecipientInternalSubidentification
data_element.desc: Sub-level of recipient internal identification, when further sub-level identification is required.

data_element.name: actionCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating acknowledgement, or rejection (the action taken) of a subject interchange, or part of the subject interchange, or indication of interchange receipt.

data_element.name: syntaxErrorCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating the error detected.

data_element.name: serviceSegmentTagCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a service segment.

composite_data_element.name: dataElementIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the position for an erroneous data element. This can be the position of a stand-alone or composite data element in the definition of a segment or a component data element in the definition of a composite data element.

data_element.name: erroneousDataElementPositionInSegment
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the stand-alone or composite data element in error. The segment code and each following stand-alone or composite data element defined in the segment description shall cause the count to be incremented. The segment tag has position number 1.

data_element.name: erroneousComponentDataElementPosition
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the component data element in error. Each component data element position defined in the composite data element description shall cause the count to be incremented. The count starts at 1.

data_element.name: erroneousDataElementOccurrence
data_element.desc: The numerical occurrence of the repeating stand-alone or composite data element in error. Each occurrence (as indicated by the repetition separator) shall cause the count to be incremented. The count starts at 1.

data_element.name: securityReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique reference number assigned by the security originator to a pair of security header and security trailer groups.

data_element.name: securitySegmentPosition
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of a specific security segment that is within the actual received security header/trailer segment group pair, identified by its security reference number. The numbering starts with, and includes, the USH segment as segment number 1. To identify a security segment that contains an error, this is the numerical count position of that security segment. To report that a security segment is missing, this is the numerical count position of the last security segment that was processed before the position where the missing security segment was expected to be. A missing security segment group is denoted by identifying the first segment in the security segment group as missing.

segment.name: messagepackageResponse
segment.desc: To identify a message or package in the subject interchange, and to indicate that message's or package's acknowledgement or rejection (action taken), and to identify any error related to the UNH, UNT, UNO, and UNP segments. It can also identify errors related to the USA, USC, USD, USH, USR, UST, or USU security segments when they appear at the message or package level.

data_element.name: messageReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique message reference assigned by the sender.

composite_data_element.name: messageIdentifier
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the type, version, etc. of the message being interchanged.

data_element.name: messageType
data_element.desc: Code identifying a type of message and assigned by its controlling agency.

data_element.name: messageVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of a message type.

data_element.name: messageReleaseNumber
data_element.desc: Release number within the current message version number.

data_element.name: controllingAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a controlling agency.

data_element.name: associationAssignedCode
data_element.desc: Code, assigned by the association responsible for the design and maintenance of the message type concerned, which further identifies the message.

data_element.name: codeListDirectoryVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of the code list directory.

data_element.name: messageTypeSubfunctionIdentification
data_element.desc: Code identifying a sub-function of a message type.

data_element.name: actionCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating acknowledgement, or rejection (the action taken) of a subject interchange, or part of the subject interchange, or indication of interchange receipt.

data_element.name: syntaxErrorCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating the error detected.

data_element.name: serviceSegmentTagCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a service segment.

composite_data_element.name: dataElementIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the position for an erroneous data element. This can be the position of a stand-alone or composite data element in the definition of a segment or a component data element in the definition of a composite data element.

data_element.name: erroneousDataElementPositionInSegment
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the stand-alone or composite data element in error. The segment code and each following stand-alone or composite data element defined in the segment description shall cause the count to be incremented. The segment tag has position number 1.

data_element.name: erroneousComponentDataElementPosition
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the component data element in error. Each component data element position defined in the composite data element description shall cause the count to be incremented. The count starts at 1.

data_element.name: erroneousDataElementOccurrence
data_element.desc: The numerical occurrence of the repeating stand-alone or composite data element in error. Each occurrence (as indicated by the repetition separator) shall cause the count to be incremented. The count starts at 1.

data_element.name: packageReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique package reference number assigned by the sender.

composite_data_element.name: referenceIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the reference relating to the object.

data_element.name: referenceQualifier
data_element.desc: Code giving specific meaning to a reference identification number.

data_element.name: referenceIdentificationNumber
data_element.desc: Reference number to identify a message, message group and/or interchange, which relates to the object.

data_element.name: securityReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique reference number assigned by the security originator to a pair of security header and security trailer groups.

data_element.name: securitySegmentPosition
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of a specific security segment that is within the actual received security header/trailer segment group pair, identified by its security reference number. The numbering starts with, and includes, the USH segment as segment number 1. To identify a security segment that contains an error, this is the numerical count position of that security segment. To report that a security segment is missing, this is the numerical count position of the last security segment that was processed before the position where the missing security segment was expected to be. A missing security segment group is denoted by identifying the first segment in the security segment group as missing.

segment.name: segmentErrorIndication
segment.desc: To identify either a segment containing an error or a missing segment, and to identify any error related to the complete segment.

data_element.name: segmentPositionInMessageBody
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of a specific segment that is within the actual received message body. The numbering starts with, and includes, the UNH or the UIH segment as segment number 1. To identify a segment that contains an error, this is the numerical count position of that segment. To report that a segment is missing, this is the numerical count position of the last segment that was processed before the position where the missing segment was expected to be. A missing segment group is denoted by identifying the first segment in the group as missing.

data_element.name: syntaxErrorCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating the error detected.

segment.name: anticollisionSegmentGroupHeader
segment.desc: To head, identify and specify an anti-collision segment group.

data_element.name: anticollisionSegmentGroupIdentification
data_element.desc: To identify uniquely an anti-collision segment group in a message.

segment.name: anticollisionSegmentGroupTrailer
segment.desc: To end and check the completeness of an anti-collision segment group.

data_element.name: anticollisionSegmentGroupIdentification
data_element.desc: To identify uniquely an anti-collision segment group in a message.

segment.name: interactiveInterchangeHeader
segment.desc: To head and identify an interchange.

composite_data_element.name: syntaxIdentifier
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the agency controlling the syntax, the syntax level and version number, and the service code directory.

data_element.name: syntaxIdentifier
data_element.desc: Coded identification of the agency controlling the syntax, and of the character repertoire used in an interchange.

data_element.name: syntaxVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of the syntax.

data_element.name: serviceCodeListDirectoryVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of the service code list directory.

data_element.name: characterEncodingCoded
data_element.desc: Coded identification of the character encoding used in the interchange.

data_element.name: syntaxReleaseNumber
data_element.desc: The number of a syntax release (within an existing syntax version number).

composite_data_element.name: dialogueReference
composite_data_element.desc: Unique reference for the dialogue between co-operating parties within the interactive EDI transaction.

data_element.name: initiatorControlReference
data_element.desc: A reference assigned by the dialogue initiator.

data_element.name: initiatorReferenceIdentification
data_element.desc: Organisation code or name assigned by the party that initiated the transaction or dialogue.

data_element.name: controllingAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a controlling agency.

data_element.name: responderControlReference
data_element.desc: A reference assigned by the dialogue responder.

composite_data_element.name: transactionReference
composite_data_element.desc: Unique reference for the business transaction to which the dialogue belongs.

data_element.name: transactionControlReference
data_element.desc: A reference assigned by the transaction initiator.

data_element.name: initiatorReferenceIdentification
data_element.desc: Organisation code or name assigned by the party that initiated the transaction or dialogue.

data_element.name: controllingAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a controlling agency.

composite_data_element.name: scenarioIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of a scenario.

data_element.name: scenarioIdentification
data_element.desc: Code identifying scenario.

data_element.name: scenarioVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of a scenario.

data_element.name: scenarioReleaseNumber
data_element.desc: Release number within the scenario version number.

data_element.name: controllingAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a controlling agency.

composite_data_element.name: dialogueIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the dialogue type being used for the interactive EDI transaction.

data_element.name: dialogueIdentification
data_element.desc: Code identifying a dialogue.

data_element.name: dialogueVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of a dialogue.

data_element.name: dialogueReleaseNumber
data_element.desc: Release number of a dialogue.

data_element.name: controllingAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a controlling agency.

composite_data_element.name: interchangeSender
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the sender of the interchange.

data_element.name: interchangeSenderIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded identification of the sender of the interchange.

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the identification code.

data_element.name: interchangeSenderInternalIdentification
data_element.desc: Identification (for example, a division, branch or computer system/process) specified by the sender of interchange, to be included if agreed, by the recipient in response interchanges, to facilitate internal routing.

data_element.name: interchangeSenderInternalSubidentification
data_element.desc: Sub-level of sender internal identification, when further sub-level identification is required.

composite_data_element.name: interchangeRecipient

data_element.desc: Name or coded identification of the recipient of the interchange.

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the identification code.

data_element.name: interchangeRecipientInternalIdentification
data_element.desc: Identification (for example, a division, branch or computer system/process) specified by the recipient of interchange, to be included if agreed, by the sender in response interchanges, to facilitate internal routing.

data_element.name: interchangeRecipientInternalSubidentification
data_element.desc: Sub-level of recipient internal identification, when further sub-level identification is required.

composite_data_element.name: dateAndorTimeOfInitiation
composite_data_element.desc: Date and/or time of event initiation.

data_element.name: eventDate
data_element.desc: Date of event.

data_element.name: eventTime
data_element.desc: Time of event.

data_element.name: timeOffset
data_element.desc: UTC (Universal Co-ordinated Time) offset from event time.

data_element.name: duplicateIndicator
data_element.desc: Indication that the structure is a duplicate of a previously sent structure.

data_element.name: testIndicator
data_element.desc: Indication that the structural level containing the test indicator is a test.

segment.name: interactiveMessageHeader
segment.desc: To head, identify and specify a message.

composite_data_element.name: interactiveMessageIdentifier
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the type, version and details of the message being interchanged.

data_element.name: messageType
data_element.desc: Code identifying a type of message and assigned by its controlling agency.

data_element.name: messageVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of a message type.

data_element.name: messageReleaseNumber
data_element.desc: Release number within the current message version number.

data_element.name: messageTypeSubfunctionIdentification

data_element.name: controllingAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a controlling agency.

data_element.name: associationAssignedCode
data_element.desc: Code, assigned by the association responsible for the design and maintenance of the message type concerned, which further identifies the message.

data_element.name: interactiveMessageReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique interactive message reference assigned by the sender.

composite_data_element.name: dialogueReference

data_element.name: initiatorControlReference
data_element.desc: A reference assigned by the dialogue initiator.

data_element.name: initiatorReferenceIdentification
data_element.desc: Organisation code or name assigned by the party that initiated the transaction or dialogue.

data_element.name: controllingAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a controlling agency.

data_element.name: responderControlReference
data_element.desc: A reference assigned by the dialogue responder.

composite_data_element.name: statusOfTransferInteractive
composite_data_element.desc: Identifies the sequence of the message/package within the sender's interchange and the position in a multi-message and/or package transfer.

data_element.name: senderSequenceNumber
data_element.desc: Identification of the sequence number of the message or package within the sender interchange.

data_element.name: transferPositionCoded
data_element.desc: Indication of the position of a transfer.

data_element.name: duplicateIndicator
data_element.desc: Indication that the structure is a duplicate of a previously sent structure.

data_element.desc: Date of event.

data_element.name: timeOffset

data_element.name: testIndicator

segment.name: interactiveStatus
segment.desc: To report the status of the dialogue. to a UIR received with syntax errors.

data_element.name: reportFunctionCoded
data_element.desc: Coded value identifying type of status or error report.

composite_data_element.name: statusInformation
composite_data_element.desc: Reason for status or error report.

data_element.name: statusCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying the reason for the status or error report.

data_element.name: status
data_element.desc: Textual explanation of the reason for the status or error report.

data_element.name: languageCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying the language used.

composite_data_element.name: dialogueReference
composite_data_element.desc: Unique reference for the dialogue between co-operating parties within the interactive EDI transaction.

data_element.name: interactiveMessageReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique interactive message reference assigned by the sender.

data_element.name: packageReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique package reference number assigned by the sender.

data_element.name: syntaxErrorCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating the error detected.

data_element.name: segmentPositionInMessageBody
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of a specific segment that is within the actual received message body. The numbering starts with, and includes, the UNH or the UIH segment as segment number 1. To identify a segment that contains an error, this is the numerical count position of that segment. To report that a segment is missing, this is the numerical count position of the last segment that was processed before the position where the missing segment was expected to be. A missing segment group is denoted by identifying the first segment in the group as missing.

composite_data_element.name: dataElementIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the position for an erroneous data element. This can be the position of a stand-alone or composite data element in the definition of a segment or a component data element in the definition of a composite data element.

data_element.name: erroneousDataElementPositionInSegment
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the stand-alone or composite data element in error. The segment code and each following stand-alone or composite data element defined in the segment description shall cause the count to be incremented. The segment tag has position number 1.

data_element.name: erroneousComponentDataElementPosition
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the component data element in error. Each component data element position defined in the composite data element description shall cause the count to be incremented. The count starts at 1.

data_element.name: erroneousDataElementOccurrence
data_element.desc: The numerical occurrence of the repeating stand-alone or composite data element in error. Each occurrence (as indicated by the repetition separator) shall cause the count to be incremented. The count starts at 1.

segment.name: interactiveMessageTrailer
segment.desc: To end and check the completeness of a message.

data_element.name: interactiveMessageReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique interactive message reference assigned by the sender.

data_element.name: numberOfSegmentsInAMessage
data_element.desc: The number of segments in a message body, plus the message header segment and message trailer segment.

segment.name: interactiveInterchangeTrailer
segment.desc: To end and check the completeness of an interchange.

composite_data_element.name: dialogueReference
composite_data_element.desc: Unique reference for the dialogue between co-operating parties within the interactive EDI transaction.

data_element.name: responderControlReference

data_element.name: interchangeControlCount

data_element.name: duplicateIndicator
data_element.desc: Indication that the structure is a duplicate of a previously sent structure.

segment.name: interchangeHeader

data_element.name: syntaxIdentifier

data_element.name: syntaxVersionNumber

data_element.name: serviceCodeListDirectoryVersionNumber

data_element.name: characterEncodingCoded

data_element.name: syntaxReleaseNumber

data_element.name: interchangeSenderIdentification

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier

data_element.name: interchangeSenderInternalIdentification

composite_data_element.name: interchangeRecipient

data_element.name: interchangeRecipientIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded identification of the recipient of the interchange.

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the identification code.

data_element.name: interchangeRecipientInternalIdentification
data_element.desc: Identification (for example, a division, branch or computer system/process) specified by the recipient of interchange, to be included if agreed, by the sender in response interchanges, to facilitate internal routing.

data_element.name: interchangeRecipientInternalSubidentification
data_element.desc: Sub-level of recipient internal identification, when further sub-level identification is required.

composite_data_element.name: dateAndTimeOfPreparation
composite_data_element.desc: Date and time of preparation of the interchange.

data_element.name: date
data_element.desc: Local date when an interchange or a group was prepared.

data_element.name: time
data_element.desc: Local time of day when an interchange or a group was prepared.

data_element.name: interchangeControlReference
data_element.desc: Unique reference assigned by the sender to an interchange.

composite_data_element.name: recipientReferencepasswordDetails
composite_data_element.desc: Reference or password as agreed between the communicating partners.

data_element.name: recipientReferencepassword
data_element.desc: Reference or password to the recipient's system or to a third party network as specified in the partners' interchange agreement.

data_element.name: recipientReferencepasswordQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier for the recipient's reference or password.

data_element.name: applicationReference
data_element.desc: Identification of the application area assigned by the sender, to which the messages in the interchange relate e.g. the message type, if all the messages in the interchange are of the same type.

data_element.name: processingPriorityCode
data_element.desc: Code determined by the sender requesting processing priority for the interchange.

data_element.name: acknowledgementRequest
data_element.desc: Code requesting acknowledgement for the interchange.

data_element.name: interchangeAgreementIdentifier
data_element.desc: Identification by name or code of the type of agreement under which the interchange takes place.

data_element.name: testIndicator
data_element.desc: Indication that the structural level containing the test indicator is a test.

segment.name: groupTrailer
segment.desc: To end and check the completeness of a group.

data_element.name: groupControlCount
data_element.desc: The number of messages and packages in the group.

data_element.name: groupReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique reference number for the group within an interchange.

segment.name: groupHeader
segment.desc: To head, identify and specify a group of messages and/or packages, which may be used for internal routing and which may contain one or more message types and/or packages.

data_element.name: messageGroupIdentification
data_element.desc: Identification of the single message type in the group.

composite_data_element.name: applicationSenderIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Sender identification of for example a division, branch or application computer system/process.

data_element.name: applicationSenderIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded identification of the application sender (for example, a division, branch or computer system/process).

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the identification code.

composite_data_element.name: applicationRecipientIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Recipient identification of for example a division, branch or application computer system/process.

data_element.name: applicationRecipientIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded identification of the application recipient (for example, a division, branch or computer system/process).

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the identification code.

composite_data_element.name: dateAndTimeOfPreparation
composite_data_element.desc: Date and time of preparation of the interchange.

data_element.name: date
data_element.desc: Local date when an interchange or a group was prepared.

data_element.name: time
data_element.desc: Local time of day when an interchange or a group was prepared.

data_element.name: groupReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique reference number for the group within an interchange.

data_element.name: controllingAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a controlling agency.

composite_data_element.name: messageVersion
composite_data_element.desc: Specification of the version and release numbers of all of the messages of a single type in the group.

data_element.name: messageVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of a message type.

data_element.name: messageReleaseNumber
data_element.desc: Release number within the current message version number.

data_element.name: associationAssignedCode
data_element.desc: Code, assigned by the association responsible for the design and maintenance of the message type concerned, which further identifies the message.

data_element.name: applicationPassword
data_element.desc: Password to the recipient's division, department or sectional application system/process.

segment.name: messageHeader
segment.desc: To head, identify and specify a message.

data_element.name: messageReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique message reference assigned by the sender.

composite_data_element.name: messageIdentifier
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the type, version, etc. of the message being interchanged.

data_element.name: messageType
data_element.desc: Code identifying a type of message and assigned by its controlling agency.

data_element.name: messageVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of a message type.

data_element.name: messageReleaseNumber
data_element.desc: Release number within the current message version number.

data_element.name: controllingAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a controlling agency.

data_element.name: associationAssignedCode
data_element.desc: Code, assigned by the association responsible for the design and maintenance of the message type concerned, which further identifies the message.

data_element.name: codeListDirectoryVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of the code list directory.

data_element.name: messageTypeSubfunctionIdentification
data_element.desc: Code identifying a sub-function of a message type.

data_element.name: commonAccessReference
data_element.desc: Reference serving as a key to relate all subsequent transfers of data to the same business case or file.

composite_data_element.name: statusOfTheTransfer
composite_data_element.desc: Statement that the message is one in a sequence of transfers relating to the same topic.

data_element.name: sequenceOfTransfers
data_element.desc: Number assigned by the sender indicating the transfer sequence of a message related to the same topic. The message could be an addition or a change to an earlier transfer related to the same topic.

data_element.name: firstAndLastTransfer
data_element.desc: Indication used for the first and last message in a sequence of messages related to the same topic.

composite_data_element.name: messageSubsetIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of a message subset by its identifier, version, release and source.

data_element.name: messageSubsetIdentification
data_element.desc: Coded identification of a message subset, assigned by its controlling agency.

data_element.name: messageSubsetVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of the message subset.

data_element.name: messageSubsetReleaseNumber
data_element.desc: Release number within the message subset version number.

data_element.name: controllingAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a controlling agency.

composite_data_element.name: scenarioIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of a scenario.

data_element.name: scenarioIdentification
data_element.desc: Code identifying scenario.

data_element.name: scenarioVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of a scenario.

data_element.name: scenarioReleaseNumber
data_element.desc: Release number within the scenario version number.

data_element.name: controllingAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a controlling agency.

segment.name: objectHeader
segment.desc: To head, identify and specify an object.

data_element.name: packageReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique package reference number assigned by the sender.

composite_data_element.name: referenceIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the reference relating to the object.

data_element.name: referenceQualifier
data_element.desc: Code giving specific meaning to a reference identification number.

data_element.name: referenceIdentificationNumber
data_element.desc: Reference number to identify a message, message group and/or interchange, which relates to the object.

composite_data_element.name: objectTypeIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the attribute related to the object type.

data_element.name: objectTypeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the type of object.

data_element.name: objectTypeAttributeIdentification
data_element.desc: Coded identification of the attribute applying to the object type.

data_element.name: objectTypeAttribute
data_element.desc: The attribute applying to the object type.

data_element.name: controllingAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a controlling agency.

composite_data_element.name: statusOfTheObject
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the length and if required the transfer status of the object.

data_element.name: lengthOfObjectInOctetsOfBits
data_element.desc: Count of the number of octets of bits in the object.

data_element.name: numberOfSegmentsBeforeObject
data_element.desc: A count of the number of segments appearing between the UNO segment and the start of the object.

data_element.name: sequenceOfTransfers
data_element.desc: Number assigned by the sender indicating the transfer sequence of a message related to the same topic. The message could be an addition or a change to an earlier transfer related to the same topic.

data_element.name: firstAndLastTransfer
data_element.desc: Indication used for the first and last message in a sequence of messages related to the same topic.

composite_data_element.name: dialogueReference
composite_data_element.desc: Unique reference for the dialogue between co-operating parties within the interactive EDI transaction.

data_element.name: initiatorControlReference
data_element.desc: A reference assigned by the dialogue initiator.

data_element.name: initiatorReferenceIdentification
data_element.desc: Organisation code or name assigned by the party that initiated the transaction or dialogue.

data_element.name: controllingAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a controlling agency.

data_element.name: responderControlReference
data_element.desc: A reference assigned by the dialogue responder.

composite_data_element.name: statusOfTransferInteractive
composite_data_element.desc: Identifies the sequence of the message/package within the sender's interchange and the position in a multi-message and/or package transfer.

data_element.name: senderSequenceNumber
data_element.desc: Identification of the sequence number of the message or package within the sender interchange.

data_element.name: transferPositionCoded
data_element.desc: Indication of the position of a transfer.

data_element.name: duplicateIndicator
data_element.desc: Indication that the structure is a duplicate of a previously sent structure.

composite_data_element.name: dateAndorTimeOfInitiation
composite_data_element.desc: Date and/or time of event initiation.

data_element.name: eventDate
data_element.desc: Date of event.

data_element.name: eventTime
data_element.desc: Time of event.

data_element.name: timeOffset
data_element.desc: UTC (Universal Co-ordinated Time) offset from event time.

data_element.name: testIndicator
data_element.desc: Indication that the structural level containing the test indicator is a test.

segment.name: objectTrailer
segment.desc: To end and check the completeness of an object.

data_element.name: lengthOfObjectInOctetsOfBits
data_element.desc: Count of the number of octets of bits in the object.

data_element.name: packageReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique package reference number assigned by the sender.

segment.name: sectionControl
segment.desc: To separate header, detail and summary sections of a message. Note: To be used by message designers only when required to avoid ambiguities.

data_element.name: sectionIdentification
data_element.desc: Identification of the separation of sections of a message.

segment.name: messageTrailer
segment.desc: To end and check the completeness of a message.

data_element.name: numberOfSegmentsInAMessage
data_element.desc: The number of segments in a message body, plus the message header segment and message trailer segment.

data_element.name: messageReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique message reference assigned by the sender.

segment.name: interchangeTrailer
segment.desc: To end and check the completeness of an interchange.

data_element.name: interchangeControlCount
data_element.desc: The number of messages and packages in an interchange or, if used, the number of groups in an interchange.

data_element.name: interchangeControlReference
data_element.desc: Unique reference assigned by the sender to an interchange.

segment.name: securityAlgorithm
segment.desc: To identify a security algorithm, the technical usage made of it, and to contain the technical parameters required.

composite_data_element.name: securityAlgorithm
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of a security algorithm.

data_element.name: useOfAlgorithmCoded
data_element.desc: Specification of the usage made of the algorithm.

data_element.name: cryptographicModeOfOperationCoded
data_element.desc: Specification of the mode of operation used for the algorithm.

data_element.name: modeOfOperationCodeListIdentifier
data_element.desc: Specification of the code list used to identify the cryptographic mode of operation.

data_element.name: algorithmCoded
data_element.desc: Identification of the algorithm.

data_element.name: algorithmCodeListIdentifier
data_element.desc: Specification of the code list used to identify the algorithm.

data_element.name: paddingMechanismCoded
data_element.desc: Padding mechanism or padding scheme applied.

data_element.name: paddingMechanismCodeListIdentifier
data_element.desc: Specification of the code list used to identify the padding mechanism or padding scheme.

composite_data_element.name: algorithmParameter
composite_data_element.desc: Parameter required by a security algorithm.

data_element.name: algorithmParameterQualifier
data_element.desc: Specification of the type of parameter value.

data_element.name: algorithmParameterValue
data_element.desc: Value of a parameter required by the algorithm.

segment.name: securedDataIdentification
segment.desc: To contain details related to the AUTACK.

data_element.name: responseTypeCoded
data_element.desc: Specification of the type of response expected from the recipient.

composite_data_element.name: securityDateAndTime
composite_data_element.desc: Security related date and time.

data_element.name: dateAndTimeQualifier
data_element.desc: Specification of the type of date and time.

data_element.name: eventDate
data_element.desc: Date of event.

data_element.name: eventTime
data_element.desc: Time of event.

data_element.name: timeOffset
data_element.desc: UTC (Universal Co-ordinated Time) offset from event time.

composite_data_element.name: interchangeSender
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the sender of the interchange.

data_element.name: interchangeSenderIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded identification of the sender of the interchange.

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the identification code.

data_element.name: interchangeSenderInternalIdentification
data_element.desc: Identification (for example, a division, branch or computer system/process) specified by the sender of interchange, to be included if agreed, by the recipient in response interchanges, to facilitate internal routing.

data_element.name: interchangeSenderInternalSubidentification
data_element.desc: Sub-level of sender internal identification, when further sub-level identification is required.

composite_data_element.name: interchangeRecipient
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the recipient of the interchange.

data_element.name: interchangeRecipientIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded identification of the recipient of the interchange.

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the identification code.

data_element.name: interchangeRecipientInternalIdentification
data_element.desc: Identification (for example, a division, branch or computer system/process) specified by the recipient of interchange, to be included if agreed, by the sender in response interchanges, to facilitate internal routing.

data_element.name: interchangeRecipientInternalSubidentification
data_element.desc: Sub-level of recipient internal identification, when further sub-level identification is required.

segment.name: certificate
segment.desc: To convey the public key and the credentials of its owner.

data_element.name: certificateReference
data_element.desc: Identifies one certificate for a certification authority.

composite_data_element.name: securityIdentificationDetails
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of parties involved in the security process.

data_element.name: securityPartyQualifier
data_element.desc: Identification of the role of the security party.

data_element.name: keyName
data_element.desc: Name used to establish a key relationship between the parties.

data_element.name: securityPartyIdentification
data_element.desc: Identification of a party involved in the security process, according to a defined registry of security parties.

data_element.name: securityPartyCodeListQualifier
data_element.desc: Identification of the type of identification used to register the security parties.

data_element.name: securityPartyCodeListResponsibleAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Identification of the agency in charge of registration of the security parties.

data_element.name: securityPartyName
data_element.desc: Name of the security party.

data_element.name: securityPartyName
data_element.desc: Name of the security party.

data_element.name: securityPartyName
data_element.desc: Name of the security party.

data_element.name: certificateSyntaxAndVersionCoded
data_element.desc: Coded identification of the syntax and version used to create the certificate.

data_element.name: filterFunctionCoded
data_element.desc: Identification of the filtering function used to reversibly map any bit pattern on to a restricted character set.

data_element.name: originalCharacterSetEncodingCoded
data_element.desc: Identification of the character set in which the secured EDIFACT structure was encoded when security mechanisms were applied.

data_element.name: userAuthorisationLevel
data_element.desc: Specification of the authorisation level associated with the owner of the certificate.

composite_data_element.name: serviceCharacterForSignature
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the characters used as syntactical service characters when a signature was computed.

data_element.name: serviceCharacterForSignatureQualifier
data_element.desc: Identification of the type of service character used when the signature was computed.

data_element.name: serviceCharacterForSignature
data_element.desc: Service character used when the signature was computed.

composite_data_element.name: securityDateAndTime
composite_data_element.desc: Security related date and time.

data_element.name: dateAndTimeQualifier
data_element.desc: Specification of the type of date and time.

data_element.name: eventDate
data_element.desc: Date of event.

data_element.name: eventTime
data_element.desc: Time of event.

data_element.name: timeOffset
data_element.desc: UTC (Universal Co-ordinated Time) offset from event time.

data_element.name: securityStatusCoded
data_element.desc: Identification of the security element (key or certificate, for instance) status.

data_element.name: revocationReasonCoded
data_element.desc: Identification of the reason why the certificate has been revoked.

segment.name: dataEncryptionHeader
segment.desc: To specify size (i.e. length of data in octets of bits) of encrypted data following the segment terminator of this segment.

data_element.name: lengthOfDataInOctetsOfBits
data_element.desc: A count of the data octets of bits.

data_element.name: encryptionReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Reference number to the encrypted EDIFACT structure.

data_element.name: numberOfPaddingBytes
data_element.desc: Count of the number of padding bytes.

segment.name: securityMessageRelation
segment.desc: To specify the relation to earlier security messages, such as response to a particular request, or request for a particular answer.

data_element.name: messageRelationCoded
data_element.desc: Relationship with another message, past or future.

segment.name: keyManagementFunction
segment.desc: To specify the type of key management function and the status of a corresponding key or certificate.

data_element.name: keyManagementFunctionQualifier
data_element.desc: Specification of the type of key management function.

composite_data_element.name: listParameter
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of a parameter for a list request or delivery

data_element.name: listParameterQualifier
data_element.desc: Specification of the type of list parameter.

data_element.name: listParameter
data_element.desc: Specification of the list requested or delivered.

data_element.name: securityStatusCoded
data_element.desc: Identification of the security element (key or certificate, for instance) status.

data_element.name: certificateSequenceNumber
data_element.desc: Specification of a certificate's position within a certification path.

data_element.name: filterFunctionCoded
data_element.desc: Identification of the filtering function used to reversibly map any bit pattern on to a restricted character set.

segment.name: securityHeader
segment.desc: To specify a security mechanism applied to a EDIFACT structure (i.e.: either message/package, group or interchange).

data_element.name: securityServiceCoded
data_element.desc: Specification of the security service applied.

data_element.name: securityReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique reference number assigned by the security originator to a pair of security header and security trailer groups.

data_element.name: scopeOfSecurityApplicationCoded
data_element.desc: Specification of the scope of application of the security service defined in the security header.

data_element.name: responseTypeCoded
data_element.desc: Specification of the type of response expected from the recipient.

data_element.name: filterFunctionCoded
data_element.desc: Identification of the filtering function used to reversibly map any bit pattern on to a restricted character set.

data_element.name: originalCharacterSetEncodingCoded
data_element.desc: Identification of the character set in which the secured EDIFACT structure was encoded when security mechanisms were applied.

data_element.name: roleOfSecurityProviderCoded
data_element.desc: Identification of the role of the security provider in relation to the secured item.

composite_data_element.name: securityIdentificationDetails
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of parties involved in the security process.

data_element.name: securityPartyQualifier
data_element.desc: Identification of the role of the security party.

data_element.name: keyName
data_element.desc: Name used to establish a key relationship between the parties.

data_element.name: securityPartyIdentification
data_element.desc: Identification of a party involved in the security process, according to a defined registry of security parties.

data_element.name: securityPartyCodeListQualifier
data_element.desc: Identification of the type of identification used to register the security parties.

data_element.name: securityPartyCodeListResponsibleAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Identification of the agency in charge of registration of the security parties.

data_element.name: securityPartyName
data_element.desc: Name of the security party.

data_element.name: securityPartyName
data_element.desc: Name of the security party.

data_element.name: securityPartyName
data_element.desc: Name of the security party.

data_element.name: securitySequenceNumber
data_element.desc: Sequence number assigned to the EDIFACT structure to which security is applied.

composite_data_element.name: securityDateAndTime
composite_data_element.desc: Security related date and time.

data_element.name: dateAndTimeQualifier
data_element.desc: Specification of the type of date and time.

data_element.name: eventDate
data_element.desc: Date of event.

data_element.name: eventTime
data_element.desc: Time of event.

data_element.name: timeOffset
data_element.desc: UTC (Universal Co-ordinated Time) offset from event time.

segment.name: securityListStatus
segment.desc: To specify the status of security objects, such as keys or certificates to be delivered in a list, and the corresponding list parameters.

data_element.name: securityStatusCoded
data_element.desc: Identification of the security element (key or certificate, for instance) status.

composite_data_element.name: listParameter
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of a parameter for a list request or delivery

data_element.name: listParameterQualifier
data_element.desc: Specification of the type of list parameter.

data_element.name: listParameter
data_element.desc: Specification of the list requested or delivered.

segment.name: securityResult
segment.desc: To contain the result of the security mechanisms.

composite_data_element.name: validationResult
composite_data_element.desc: Result of the application of the security mechanism.

data_element.name: validationValueQualifier
data_element.desc: Identification of the type of validation value.

data_element.name: validationValue
data_element.desc: Security result corresponding to the security function specified.

segment.name: securityTrailer
segment.desc: To establish a link between security header and security trailer segment groups.

data_element.name: securityReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique reference number assigned by the security originator to a pair of security header and security trailer groups.

data_element.name: numberOfSecuritySegments
data_element.desc: The number of security segments in a security header/trailer group pair, plus the USD and USU segments where the security header/trailer group pair is used for encryption.

segment.name: dataEncryptionTrailer
segment.desc: To provide a trailer for the encrypted data.

data_element.name: lengthOfDataInOctetsOfBits
data_element.desc: A count of the data octets of bits.

data_element.name: encryptionReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Reference number to the encrypted EDIFACT structure.

segment.name: securityReferences
segment.desc: To refer to the secured EDIFACT structure and its associated date and time.

data_element.name: interchangeControlReference
data_element.desc: Unique reference assigned by the sender to an interchange.

composite_data_element.name: interchangeSender
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the sender of the interchange.

data_element.name: interchangeSenderIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded identification of the sender of the interchange.

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the identification code.

data_element.name: interchangeSenderInternalIdentification
data_element.desc: Identification (for example, a division, branch or computer system/process) specified by the sender of interchange, to be included if agreed, by the recipient in response interchanges, to facilitate internal routing.

data_element.name: interchangeSenderInternalSubidentification
data_element.desc: Sub-level of sender internal identification, when further sub-level identification is required.

composite_data_element.name: interchangeRecipient
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the recipient of the interchange.

data_element.name: interchangeRecipientIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded identification of the recipient of the interchange.

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the identification code.

data_element.name: interchangeRecipientInternalIdentification
data_element.desc: Identification (for example, a division, branch or computer system/process) specified by the recipient of interchange, to be included if agreed, by the sender in response interchanges, to facilitate internal routing.

data_element.name: interchangeRecipientInternalSubidentification
data_element.desc: Sub-level of recipient internal identification, when further sub-level identification is required.

data_element.name: groupReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique reference number for the group within an interchange.

composite_data_element.name: applicationSenderIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Sender identification of for example a division, branch or application computer system/process.

data_element.name: applicationSenderIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded identification of the application sender (for example, a division, branch or computer system/process).

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the identification code.

composite_data_element.name: applicationRecipientIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Recipient identification of for example a division, branch or application computer system/process.

data_element.name: applicationRecipientIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded identification of the application recipient (for example, a division, branch or computer system/process).

data_element.name: identificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the identification code.

data_element.name: messageReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique message reference assigned by the sender.

composite_data_element.name: messageIdentifier
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the type, version, etc. of the message being interchanged.

data_element.name: messageType
data_element.desc: Code identifying a type of message and assigned by its controlling agency.

data_element.name: messageVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of a message type.

data_element.name: messageReleaseNumber
data_element.desc: Release number within the current message version number.

data_element.name: controllingAgencyCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a controlling agency.

data_element.name: associationAssignedCode
data_element.desc: Code, assigned by the association responsible for the design and maintenance of the message type concerned, which further identifies the message.

data_element.name: codeListDirectoryVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of the code list directory.

data_element.name: messageTypeSubfunctionIdentification
data_element.desc: Code identifying a sub-function of a message type.

data_element.name: packageReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique package reference number assigned by the sender.

composite_data_element.name: securityDateAndTime
composite_data_element.desc: Security related date and time.

data_element.name: dateAndTimeQualifier
data_element.desc: Specification of the type of date and time.

data_element.name: eventDate
data_element.desc: Date of event.

data_element.name: eventTime
data_element.desc: Time of event.

data_element.name: timeOffset
data_element.desc: UTC (Universal Co-ordinated Time) offset from event time.

segment.name: securityOnReferences
segment.desc: To identify the applicable header, and to contain the security result and/or to indicate the possible cause of security rejection for the referred value.

data_element.name: securityReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique reference number assigned by the security originator to a pair of security header and security trailer groups.

composite_data_element.name: validationResult
composite_data_element.desc: Result of the application of the security mechanism.

data_element.name: validationValueQualifier
data_element.desc: Identification of the type of validation value.

data_element.name: validationValue
data_element.desc: Security result corresponding to the security function specified.

data_element.name: securityErrorCoded
data_element.desc: Identifies the security error causing the rejection of the EDIFACT structure.
